definition: to overturn/to collapse/to lean/to tend/to incline/to pour out
to crush together (in a crowd)/to make friends/to check (accounts)
to crush/to knock sb down with a vehicle

sentences.english: Firms are also suing each other.
sentences.chinese: 同時，各公司也在互相傾軋。

sentences.english: Hope for United States aid played a great part in the jockeying between contending factions.
sentences.chinese: 爭取獲得美援的希望，大大促進了各派系的相互傾軋。

sentences.english: The forces of unreason destroy one another in futile strife.
sentences.chinese: 而那些非理性的力量則在無益的傾軋中互相毀滅。

sentences.english: It has, rightly, reported on the crushing of protests and internet censorship.
sentences.chinese: 它公正地報道了抗議示威與網上審查間的相互傾軋。

sentences.english: Jostling against one another under the domination of desires, who will think of lenient hoary mother?
sentences.chinese: 在慾望的支配下彼此傾軋，有誰想到仁愛年老的母親？

definition: toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
plethora of things to tackle/multitude of loose ends/very complicated/chaotic
